text:
He is a 45-year-old man with a past medical history most notable for
   obesity, diabetes, hypertension, and multiple orthopedic procedures. Pt
   has bipap maching at home but stated he does not use r/t
claustrophobia.
  He underwent left knee total arthroplasty by Dr.
   [**Last Name (STitle) **] on [**2131-1-11**].  His post-operative course is detailed in the record
   but is especially notable for acute renal failure (Cr 1.0
 3.0
 2.0),
   hypoxemia, and hypercarbia.  Hypercarbia was attributed to narcotics in
   the setting of OSA, and he was treated with nalaxone. On [**1-15**] pt was on
   nasal CPAP on the floor and remained hypercarbic and acidodic. Was
   transferred from 12 R to M/SICU overnight for further mgt. Upon arrival
   to M/SICU pt was placed on NIMV 15/5 and 60% FIO2 by RRT. Pt was mildly
   disoriented and anxious following placement of mask ventilation. ABG
   following one hour of NIMV was 7.26/75/193. Medical team aware and
   decision made to continue NIMV.
   Overnight Events:
          At approx 0245 pt suddenly became disoriented and agitated
   with MD team present prepping for a-line placement. He pulled off his
   face mask and yelled for
police to be called.
 He said he thought he
   was in a
secure facility
 and demanded to see credentials of all staff
   in room. He attempted to pull out IV
s but was unsuccessful. Code
   purple called and security and police arrived shortly. Pt did not
   become physically violent and did not require restraint.
          Attempts made by RN and medical team to re-orient pt
   unsuccessful and decision made to intubate pt. Pt was orally intubated
   by anesthesia at approx 0315, tube placement confirmed by CXR.
          Following intubation pt went into narrow complex SVT w/ HR
   130-150. MD performed carotid massage and SVT converted to SR. Pt was
   requiring 80mcs/hr propofol for adequate sedation and SBP dropped to
   80
s w/ MAP to 40
s. 1000cc NS bolus hung and propofol gtt stopped. SBP
   improved to >100 and pt became restless and sedation restarted with
   fentanyl and midaz.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 2**])
   Assessment:
   Pt intubated
   Vent AC 20/600 PEEP 5, FIO2 0.60
   02 sats 98-100%
   LS rhonchi upper, diminished bases.
   Hemodynamically stable at present.
   Sedated w/ fentanyl and midaz gtts.
   Action:
   Suctioned copious amts thick white.
   Medical team placing central access and a-line at present.
   Response:
   02 sats remain 98-100%
   HR and BP remain stable.
   Plan:
   Re-check ABG following a-line placement (pt difficult arterial stick)
   Heparin gtt ordered to be started post-line placement r/t ? PE
   LENI
s ordered for today.
   Cont to monitor oxygenation and ventilation.
   Cont to monitor pts vitals.
